result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Omar Hassan Wesley was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in court appearing by video with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Video Coordinator Michael Pook, also in court.  Parties received and reviewed the Dr. report dated October 20, 2016 and WCS report dated October 28, 2016.  

Hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. Elliot Lee.  Arguments heard.  The Court grants the petition to revoke the conditional release.  Defendant's conditional release is revoked.  The Court finds the defendant lacks capacity to refuse medication.  The Court orders medication can be administered by the facility to the defendant against his will.  Order for Placement and Order on Petition to Revoke Conditional Release, filed and signed.

records.descr: Petition to revoke order for supervised release

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tewana Marshall, Conditional Release   Specialist also appeared.   Parties received and reviewed the conditional release plan.  Corrections made.  

AS TO PHASE 3:
The Court finds defendant appropriate for conditional release and approved the conditional release plan.   Defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services, FORTHWITH, for a period of 9 years concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 373 days time served.  Defendant may be released to the custody of Tewana Marshall or her designee.  Order of Commitment and Order for Placement, signed and filed.

- Defendant ordered no DNA sample and no DNA surcharge in this case.  Defendant previously provided a sample and paid a DNA surcharge, The Court only requires that the defendant do so once.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges if applicable under Wisconsin Statutes 971.17.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Proposed Conditional Release Treatment Plan, received via mail and filed.
Proposed Conditional Release Treatment Plan, received via fax and filed.
Received telephone call from Debra in the jail stating Mendota will not accept defendant because he has a pending conditional release order.  Email to parties sent informing them of the same.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Parties informed the Court after further discussions,  the defendant plead to the wrong offense.  The state filed an amended information.  The Court withdraws the defendant's projected guilty plea held on May 12, 2016.  

AS TO PHASE 1
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction WITHHELD.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  

AS TO PHASE 2
Parties have reviewed the doctor's report date March 28, 2016.  The Court adopts the findings made by Dr Pankiewicz in that report.  The Court adopts the same findings made previously on May 12, 2016.  The Predispostion Investigation (PDI) filed and signed on May 13, 2016 is withdrawn by the Court.  The defendant's commitment is ordered FORTHWITH.  Order for Conditional Release Plan, filed and signed by the Court.     Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 26.

Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty and not guilty by mental disease.  Review hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Amended.
Request for an extension for the PDI until July 6, 2016 from WCS, received and filed.

Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

AS TO PHASE 1

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.   Judgment of conviction withheld.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.

AS TO PHASE 2

Parties have reviewed doctor's report dated March 28, 2016.  The state does not dispute the findings.  The Court takes judicial notice of the report and adopts the findings and opinions of Dr. Pankiewicz.  The Court ordered defendant not guilty by mental disease or defect.  Court ordered case adjourned for dispostion as to phase 3 in Branch 26.  PDI ordered. Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

The defendant has entered a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.16 Wisconsin Statutes. Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit/Dr. Pankiewicz.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.     Court ordered case adjourned for doctor's report return in Branch 26.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, and right to a preliminary hearing.  The criminal complaint was reviewed with defendant.

Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Omar Hassan Wesley in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
